Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>By / Ernest Hemingway &#xD;
An adaptation by / imitating the dog &#xD;
&#xD;
Acclaimed theatre makers imitating the dog bring their unique theatrical vision to this adaptation of A Farewell To Arms, one of the great love stories of the twentieth century. &#xD;
&#xD;
In war-torn Italy, 1918, ambulance driver Frederic Henry begins a relationship with nurse Catherine Barkley, discovering the redemptive power of love whilst experiencing a loss of innocence in a time of devastating conflict. This new adaptation will fuse video projection, stage design and original music to create an extraordinary version of Hemingway’s powerful meditation on love and the brutality of modern warfare.&#xD;
&#xD;
"multi-platform theatre makers of rare ambition" - The Guardian&#xD;
&#xD;
Autumn 4 or 8 Show Evening Package&#xD;
&#xD;
Book 4 or more shows in the same band and save up to £50&#xD;
Book 8 or more shows in the same band and save up to £100&#xD;
&#xD;
Book all your tickets in the same price band (Premium or Band A) for your choice of Midsummer Songs, Private Peaceful, The Trials Of Oscar Wilde, Champions Of Magic, The Kings Of Cool, Eric And Little Ern, Songbird: The Music Of Eva Cassidy, Mugenkyo Taiko Drummers, Three Men In A Boat, The Magnificent Music Hall, Mud Morganfield, A Farewell To Arms and This Is My Family. The discount will automatically be applied. For further details visit www.wolseytheatre.co.uk/eveningpackages</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
